Španac sudi Zvezdi protiv Totenhema! Već je bio na Marakani, svirao penal i dozvolio grublju igru
Sudio je i Partizanu

04 Nov 2019

Španski sudija Karlos del Sero Grande se posle nešto više od dve godine vraća na Marakanu da sudi Crvenoj zvezdi. Prvi put u Ligi šampiona.
Španac je određen za delioca pravde na meču srpskog šampiona i Totenhema u četvrtom kolu Lige šampiona naredne srede od 21.00 čas.
Prethodno je već sudio Crvenoj zvezdi u meču trećeg kola kvalifikacija za Ligu šampiona prošle godine protiv Spartaka iz Trnave. Bilo je 1:1, a Zvezda je jedini pogodak dala iz opravdano dosuđenog penala.
Ono po čemu se taj meč možda i najviše pameti je gruba igra sa mnogo faulova koju je dozvolio španski sudija. Gosti su napravili 22 faula, Zvezda duplo manje. Uprkos gruboj igri, Španac je pokazao samo tri žuta kartona. Dva Slovacima i jedan Zvezdi. Utisak je da je imao mekši kriterijum i sozvolio igru koja je više odgovarala gostima. U trenerskoj eri Vladana Milojevića, retko ko je tako „pretukao“ Zvezdu kao Spartak tada.
Del Sero Grande je ranije sudio i Partizanu protiv Skenderbega kada su crno-beli u Humskoj slavili 2:0 i odsudio je meč bez greške.
Ukupno je u međunardonim takmičenjima sudio u 37 utakmica. Domaćima je dosudio devet penala, gostima samo jedan. Domaćinima je pokazao dva crvena kartona, gostima pet. Ove sezone je u Ligi šampiona sudio meč Benfika – Zenit koji su Portugalci rešili u svoju korist sa 3:1, a pre toga je u plej-ofu sudio duela Olimpijakosa i Krasnodara koji su Grci pobedili sa 4:0.
Prošle sezone je sudio četiri meča u Ligi šampiona. Dva puta je bio taličan Mančester Sitiju u gostujućim pobedama nad Šalkeom i Šahrjorom, a dva puta je pravdu delio Ajaksu: U domaćem remiju sa Juventusom i domaćoj pobedi protiv AEK-a. Minule sezone je sudio i tri meča u Ligi Evrope, među kojima je i polufinalni okršaj Ajntrahta i Čelsija u Frankfurtu.
Inače, Del Sero Grande je po zanimanju policajac.
(FOTO: MN Press)
text:
Spaniard sues Star against Tottenham! He was already at Marakana, playing penalty and allowing a rough play
He also sued Partizan

04 Nov 2019

Spanish judge Carlos del Sero Grande returns to Maracana to try the Red Star after just over two years. First time in the Champions League.
The Spaniard has been selected as a Justice Dealer between the Serbian Champion and Tottenham in the fourth round of the Champions League next Wednesday from 9pm.
He had previously judged Red Star in the third round of Champions League qualifying last year against Spartak Trnava. It was 1: 1 and Zvezda gave the only goal from a justifiably awarded penalty.
What makes this match perhaps the most memorable is the rough play with many fouls allowed by the Spanish referee. The guests made 22 fouls, a star twice less. Despite the rough play, the Spaniard showed only three yellow cards. Two Slovaks and one Star. The impression was that it had a softer criterion and created a game that suited the guests more. In the coaching era of Vladan Milojevic, there was rarely anyone who "beat" Star like Spartacus back then.
Del Sero Grande also previously courted Partizan against Skenderbeg when the Black and Whites celebrated 2-0 at Humska and won the match without error.
He has judged in 37 games in international competitions. He gave the home team nine penalties, only one for the guests. He showed the home team two red cards, five to the guests. This season, the Champions League match Benfica - Zenit, which the Portuguese settled in their favor with 3: 1, and before that he played in the playoffs duel Olympiacos and Krasnodar, which the Greeks won with 4: 0.
Last season he judged four Champions League matches. He was twice as talented as Manchester City in away victories over Schalke and Shahryor, and twice shared justice with Ajax: In a home draw with Juventus and a home win against AEK. Last season he also judged three matches in the Europa League, including the semi-final clash of Eintracht and Chelsea in Frankfurt.
By the way, Del Sero Grande is a police officer by profession.
(PHOTO: MN Press)
